definition: fantastic oddities of every description (idiom); grotesquely shaped

sentences.english: The water had sculptured the rocks into strange shapes.
sentences.chinese: 水把岩石侵蝕成了奇形怪狀。

sentences.english: He has built these scraps of metal into a very strange - looking sculpture .
sentences.chinese: 他把這些金屬碎片造成一個奇形怪狀的雕塑品。

sentences.english: Stones of grotesque forms are often attractive with underlaid lines and water holes.
sentences.chinese: 奇形怪狀的石頭常帶有引人注目的波紋，線條和水孔。

sentences.english: Here are a large amount of Taihu Stones with strange shapes in various poses, all vivid to life.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是一片奇形怪狀的太湖石，千姿百態，惟妙惟肖。

sentences.english: Stones of grotesque forms are often attractive with undulated lines and water holes.
sentences.chinese: 奇形怪狀的石頭常帶有引人注目的波紋線條和水孔。

sentences.english: He has built these scraps of metal into a very strange-looking sculpture.
sentences.chinese: 他把這些金屬碎片造成一個奇形怪狀的雕塑品。

sentences.english: The grotesque stones come from the nearby Lake Tai.
sentences.chinese: 這些奇形怪狀的石頭來自附近的太湖。

sentences.english: This is already inside the dragon's body, everywhere are these weird stalactites .
sentences.chinese: 這已經是在龍肚裏面了，到處都是奇形怪狀的鐘乳石。

sentences.english: You just asked how could a weird sword like this cut a person?
sentences.chinese: 你剛纔問這種奇形怪狀的刀要怎麼斬人？

sentences.english: Fluid dynamics has a number of applications, from the bizarre to the mundane.
sentences.chinese: 流體力學有着非常多的應用，從奇形怪狀的到平淡的。

definition: living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
